label: Drama
definition: A planned, creative, rendition of discourse involving two or more participants.
comments: Usually a drama involves mimesis of events, either real or imagined.

label: Formulaic Discourse
definition: A ritually or conventionally structured discourse.

label: Interactive Discourse
definition: Linguistic communication between two or more participants.

label: Elicitation
definition: The performer/consultant is given a framework but does not necessary plan his/her answer.

label: Language Play
definition: A language whose primary function is to be part of play, or a style of speech that involves a creative manipulation of the structures of the language.

label: Oratory
definition: Public speaking, or speaking eloquently according to rules or conventions.

label: Narrative
definition: A monologic discourse which represents temporally organized events.

label: Procedural Discourse
definition: An explanation or description of a method, process, or situation having ordered steps.

label: Report
definition: A factual account of some event or circumstance.

label: Singing
definition: Words or sounds articulated in succession with musical inflections or modulations of the voice.

label: Instrumental Music
definition: Music intended to be performed by a musical instrument or group of instruments.

label: Unintelligible Speech
definition: Utterances that are not intended to be interpretable as ordinary language.
